description: Best partition app in the Market

great work people .. thank you for making it free

gparted is garbage.
The sooner people except that fact the sooner we will stop seeing reviews and forum posts saying how one did this or that and it wouldn't work "i used gparted to make my partitions" they always say.
There is much better tools out there that are just as easy to use.
Stop being a baby and learn to use the CLI.

Have used a lot of them; right from the beginning; when to get just two OS running on a machine (Lilo) was a kind of a achievement. Then came partition magic for windows; great at the time. But over a decade now I have used this free open source software; and it has only a few times let me down. I got sometimes a whole lot of operating systems running on a laptop; thanks to it; _ often changing/moving partitions; due shortage of space. Equally well it served me through some major transitions; like MBR to GPT, BIOS to UEFI. A great piece of software that has managed to remain abreast with the new developments without loosing its robustness and without bells and whistles mind you. Thank you folks!
summary: For me since a decade a must-have!

description: must to have for linux users

Not too concerned that it didnt work. The fact I cant remove the program or delete any of the downloaded files for it is a concern. Its now stopping other things from being installed as its hogging some of the system even though it not supposed to be running.

description: An advance app for formating a usb drive. Please add some feature, like fixing a read only usb to writable usb. Thanks
I have been using this app since the beginning and it have never left me behind. So easy and powerful! A must-have to all linuxes users!

This is my go-to when it comes to installing an OS on my rig. From creating an EFI-Partition with specific boot flags to changing the partition table in case you need to, it does it all... literally. I have a seperate USB dedicated to booting Linux Ubuntu simply so I could use gparted (as it comes pre-installed with the .iso image by default. It eventually gets wiped as you update and install your full Linux system). Would recommend to literally anybody looking to install an OS and make a partition.

+ Easy to use, fast, intuitive
- Does not include support for some file systems (very disappointing)
great for all storage , it even fix bad usb drives 90% success rate , do the job needed in pro style

description: Ich nutze es seit Jahren und hatte keine gravierenden Probleme damit. Das Kubuntu Tool gefällt mit nicht so gut und damit gab es mehr Probleme. Ich wünsche mir zusätzlich die Möglichkeit Images von Datenträger und Partitionen erzeugen zu können, wei bei Disks, aber dann mit Datenreduktion.

Die Anwendung läuft ganz gut, allerdings braucht sie wohl etwas liebe. Die Oberfläche ist teilweise etwas missverständlich und die Menüführung ist nicht sonderlich intuitiv.
Ich vermisse weitergehende funktionen um BTRFS, XFS und ZFS einzustellen und allenfalls auch Snapshots zu machen, die man vielleicht auf ein anderes Laufwerk schreiben möchte. Auch die Möglichkeit eine partition ohne Freien Speicher zu kopieren wäre schön.
summary: Läuft gut aber die Anwendung braucht etwas liebe

Del software no tengo nada que decir, sino que hace bien lo que dice hacer. En las ocasiones que he tenido problemas, ha sido porque la unidad de disco duro tenía algún detalle. Ahora bien, a los señores de Ubuntu Software les quiero decir: ¿cómo tomar en serio su gestor de instalación de software cuando ponen que GParted es software Propietario (Privativo)? En el sitio web de la aplicación GParted https://gparted.org/ claramente se puede leer:

Free Software

GParted is free software.
You have the freedom to run, copy, distribute, study, change, and improve GParted.
You do not have to pay money to use GParted.
GParted is distributed under the GNU General Public License version 2 or (at your option) any later version.
